attributes.action: Ensure Unpaid Parking tickets cannot reach over £100 in charges
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Recently my hardworking mum, of two grown up children, as a mental health nurse she has a hard job which requires work not only in work but out of work to.
She misplaced the parking ticket and now finds herself owing over £700 pounds in fines.
Does this seem fair? Is this what our government is supporting?

My mum got her parking ticket because she was going into the hospital to help a women who had been faint in the town center, had kindly tried to help the women and was told to move her car before she she took the women in the hospital.
£700 pounds would be able to help pay our morgage for a month in this difficult time that Britain is going through.
I am 18 years old and have already realised we are living in a greedy, deviant society also known as Britain.

One example of this: You cant vote unless you go on 'myvote', so if we miss the deadline- our views aren't counted?
WOW. The government have thought of it all.
